result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold J Bonilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Harold J Bonilla is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Harold J Bonilla was found guilty of Child Abuse-High Probability/Great Harm, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(c).
  • Harold J Bonilla was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Harold J Bonilla was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Due to finanical hardship, Court waived all costs, surcharges and supervision fees except for mandatory surcharges.  DOC to collect from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts three and four; consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 148 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Be supervised by the mental health unit.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations.
No contact with Jacqueline V.
No violent contact with the children.  Contact as ordered by Children's Court or the Bureau of Child Welfare.
No contact with firearms.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never psosess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide DNA sample, pay surcharge; his her voting rights are susupended and he may never possess firearms.

Received and filed:  Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING Proceedings commencing JUNE 10, 2014  (47 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.  Copy provided to:  Institution.

Defendant Harold J Bonilla in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Harold J Bonilla in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Jacqueline V. 
AS TO COUNT 2:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 3 and 4, consecutive to any other sentence, ; credit for 148 days served.  Court ordered 7 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 4; credit for 148 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 4:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 2 and 3 ; credit for 148 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Be supervised by the mental health unit.
- No further violations of the law.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with Jacqueline V.
- No violent contact with the children.  Contact as ordered by Children's Court or the Bureau of Child Welfare.
- No contact with firearms.
- Due to financial hardhip, Court waived all costs, surcharges and supervision fees except for mandatory surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, pay , his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-10-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Harold J Bonilla in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Harold J Bonilla in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Counts 2, 3 and 4:
On motion of the State, Court orders penalty enhancer DISMISSED.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the amended counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED.

As to Counts 5, 6 and 7:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 5, 6 and 7 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.

Jury trial is vacated.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
